item.title: Linux Graphics for Small Devices at FISL
item.author: Author
item.description: Last week I’ve been in Brazil at 11th International Free Software Forum (FISL) talking about Linux Graphics for Small Devices*. I tried to cover a bit of everything that I learned in the world I’ve been immersed in some near past - I guess there aren’t many news for freedesktopers though. Anyway, everyone is very welcome to give any kind of feedback and comment on it. Just follow here. *actually, two nights in Porto Alegre and two nights in Curitiba.

item.title: Xorg: What is it, and what does it mean?
item.author: Author
item.description: Just a thought is this something that should be deleted? This seems to be using about 7% of my RAM I don’t have words for it.

item.title: my dear diary... (some not-so-old memories)
item.author: Author
item.description: Portland, OR I was so proud for the forth time be part of the X crew, this time in Portland. Really amazing the city. I had the opportunity to play tourist and visit some nice places. My X conferences BTW, I just collect the photos of all four X conferences that I’ve attended. It’s not much photos but there’s some funny things :) X on embedded The cool thing of the work that I’m doing at Nokia is that I can publish and discuss mostly all X fun with the open source communities.

item.title: MacOSX -> GNU/Linux
item.author: Author
item.description: I used a part of the money that I earned on the SoC 2007 to buy a laptop to me. My university friends found a good price of a MacBook and we went to the shop in a total of 6 people (!) to buy this laptop trying to get some discount. It cost R$ 3400 (about USD 1800), a very cheap value to the Brazil standards. Fine. My MacBook arrived one week ago.

item.title: Hello world!
item.author: Author
item.description: This is my first post and even my first blog. Well, the blog’s intention is to bring in evidence my interests about linux (and maybe music).
